title: NHIS/NHANES Health Inequality Analysis
summary: Producing equity metrics and reproducible findings from multi-year national health survey data.
overview: This project analyzes multi-year data from the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) and National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) to study health outcome disparities across income levels, race/ethnicity, and other social determinants. The work produces reproducible equity metrics for peer-reviewed research and policy recommendations.
myRole: I lead the data workflow and harmonization efforts, building SAS and SPSS pipelines that process complex survey data from multiple years and produce standardized equity metrics. I developed workflows for calculating Slope Index of Inequality (SII), Relative Index of Inequality (RII), and ridit scores. I also manage data quality assurance, handle multi-year data harmonization challenges, and ensure reproducibility of all analyses for manuscript preparation.
outcomes: Built reproducible SAS workflows that cut analysis time by 40% and improved data quality
Harmonized 20+ years of NHIS data across multiple survey redesigns
Produced equity metrics (SII, RII, ridit scores) for multiple manuscripts in preparation
Established quality assurance protocols that caught and prevented data errors in published analyses
Created documentation and training materials for team members and collaborators
